Package game

Interface GamePlayer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameComputerPlayer, GameHumanPlayer, ProxyPlayer, RummyComputerPlayer, RummyHumanPlayer
    public interface GamePlayer
    A player who plays a (generic) game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void finishUp()
      Notifies the player that all players have acknowledged that the game will be "quit".
      void gameIsOver()
      Notifies a player that the game is over.
      int getId()
      Gets the player's numeric id from the pespective of the game it's playing in.
      void illegalMove()
      Notifies a player that the move he made is illegal.
      void invalidRequest()
      Notifies a player that a request he had made is invalid.
      boolean isReady()
      Tells whether the player is ready to play the game.
      void notYourMove()
      Notifies the player know that it's not his move.
      void requestMove()
      Lets the player know that the game object wants him to make a move.
      void setGame​(Game game, int playerId)
      Lets the player know what the game object is.
      void stateChanged()
      Notifies a player that the state of the game has changed.
      void timeToQuit()
      Notifies a player that it is time to quit.

    • Method Detail

      • setGame

        void setGame​(Game game,
             int playerId)
        Lets the player know what the game object is.
        Parameters:
        game - the game object
        playerId - the unique numeric player-id assigned to this player by the game

      • requestMove

        void requestMove()
        Lets the player know that the game object wants him to make a move.

      • notYourMove

        void notYourMove()
        Notifies the player know that it's not his move. Typically called by the game object when the player has made a move out-of-turn.

      • timeToQuit

        void timeToQuit()
        Notifies a player that it is time to quit. Typically called by the game object when a player has indicated a desire to quit.

      • invalidRequest

        void invalidRequest()
        Notifies a player that a request he had made is invalid. (For example, if the player request a "quit", but he is not allowed to.) Typically called by the game object.

      • illegalMove

        void illegalMove()
        Notifies a player that the move he made is illegal. (For example, moving a non-king checkers-piece backwards.) Typically called by the game object when an illegal move has been detected.

      • gameIsOver

        void gameIsOver()
        Notifies a player that the game is over. Typically called by the game object when the game has been terminated.

      • stateChanged

        void stateChanged()
        Notifies a player that the state of the game has changed. Typically called by the game object when an opponent has made a move, and the player may want to take the move into account (e.g., to display it on the screen.

      • finishUp

        void finishUp()
        Notifies the player that all players have acknowledged that the game will be "quit". Gives the player last chance to "clean up". (E.g., closing windows, terminating network connections, closing files.) Typically called by the Game object just before the entire program terminates.

      • getId

        int getId()
        Gets the player's numeric id from the pespective of the game it's playing in. (E.g., 0 if player 0, 1 if player 1.)
        Returns:
        the player's numeric id, from the game's viewpoint.

      • isReady

        boolean isReady()
        Tells whether the player is ready to play the game.
        Returns:
        a Boolean value indicating whether the player is ready to play.
